meta.name: description
meta.content: Stock screener for investors and traders, financial visualizations.

meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Stock Screener, Charts, Quotes, Maps, News, Financial Visualizations, Research, Trading Systems

tr.td:
<span class="body-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Order] body=["
Select the criteria by which the output information will be sorted. The order settings apply to all views. Use the ascending and descending option to invert the current order.
TIP: In table views you can click on top of a column to sort the table by the underlying values.
] delay=[500]">Order:

<span class="body-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Signal] body=["
                
                  

                    You can screen the stocks by signal - an event, by which traders usually enter or exit positions.
                  
                ] delay=[500]">Signal:

<span class="body-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Tickers] body=["
                
                  

                    
                      To screen through a selected set of stocks, you can enter one or more tickers directly, such as 'MSFT,GOOG,AAPL'. The screening process will run only on the specified stocks. No input ticker(s) equals all stocks. The open in screener option in the Search, will copy the listed tickers to the screener's ticker box automatically.
                    
                  
                ] offsetx=[-100] delay=[500]">Tickers:

<a href="screener.ashx?v=150&ft=4" onmouseover="lightup('pic_filter_inv')" onmouseout="turnoff('pic_filter_inv')"title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Filters] body=["
                
                  

                    
                      To optimize the screening by various stock-related criteria, you can use one or more Filters.
                    
                  
                ] offsetx=[-305] delay=[500]">

<a href="screener.ashx?v=152&ft=4" onmouseover="lightup('pic_setting')" onmouseout="turnoff('pic_setting')"title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[View Settings] body=["
                
                  

                    
                      Here you can define your Table - Custom view, which is suitable for export for instance.
                    
                  
                ] offsetx=[-305] delay=[500]">
&nbsp&nbsp Descriptive &nbsp&nbsp
&nbsp&nbsp Fundamental &nbsp&nbsp
&nbsp&nbsp Technical &nbsp&nbsp
&nbsp&nbsp All &nbsp&nbsp

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Exchange] body=["
                
                  

                    Stock Exchange at which a stock is listed.
                  
                ] delay=[500]">Exchange

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Index] body=["
                
                  

                    A major index membership of a stock.
                  
                ] delay=[500]">Index

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Sector] body=["
                
                  

                    The sector which a stock belongs to.
                  
                ] delay=[500]">Sector

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Industry] body=["
                
                  

                    The industry which a stock belongs to.
                  
                ] delay=[500]">Industry

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Country] body=["
                
                  

                    The country where company of selected stock is based.
                  
                ] offsetx=[-305] delay=[500]">Country

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Market Capitalization] body=["
                
                  

                    Equals The total dollar market value of all of a company's outstanding shares.
                  
                ] delay=[500]">Market Cap.

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Price-to-Earnings Ratio] body=["
                
                  

                    A valuation ratio of a company's current share price compared to its per-share earnings (ttm).
                  
                ] delay=[500]">P/E

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Forward Price-to-Earnings Ratio] body=["
                
                  

                    A measure of the price-to-earnings ratio using forecasted earnings for the P/E calculation. Value for next fiscal year.
                  
                ] delay=[500]">Forward P/E

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Price-to-Earnings-to-Growth] body=["
                
                  

                    A ratio used to determine a stock's value while taking into account earnings growth.
                  
                ] delay=[500]">PEG

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Price-to-Sales Ratio] body=["
                
                  

                    P/S number reflects the value placed on sales by the market. It is calculated by dividing the current closing price of the stock by the dollar-sales value per share.
                  
                ] offsetx=[-305] delay=[500]">P/S

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Price-to-Book Ratio] body=["
                
                  

                    A ratio used to compare a stock's market value to its book value. It is calculated by dividing the current closing price of the stock by the latest quarter's book value per share.
                  
                ] delay=[500]">P/B

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Price-to-Cash Ratio] body=["
                
                  

                    A ratio used to compare a stock's market value to its cash assets. It is calculated by dividing the current closing price of the stock by the latest quarter's cash per share.
                  
                ] delay=[500]">Price/Cash

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Price to Free Cash Flow (ttm)] body=["
                
                  

                    A valuation metric that compares a company's market price to its level of annual free cash flow.
                  
                ] delay=[500]">Price/Free Cash Flow

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Earnings Per Share, Growth This Year] body=["
EPS is the portion of a company's profit allocated to each outstanding share of common stock. EPS serves as an indicator of a company's profitability.
Value for current fiscal year.
] delay=[500]">EPS growth
this year

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Earnings Per Share, Growth Next Year] body=["
EPS is the portion of a company's profit allocated to each outstanding share of common stock. EPS serves as an indicator of a company's profitability.
Estimate for next fiscal year.
] delay=[500]">EPS growth
next year

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Earnings Per Share, Growth Past 5 Years] body=["
EPS is the portion of a company's profit allocated to each outstanding share of common stock. EPS serves as an indicator of a company's profitability.
Annual growth over past 5 years.
] delay=[500]">EPS growth
past 5 years

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Earnings Per Share, Growth Next 5 Years] body=["
EPS is the portion of a company's profit allocated to each outstanding share of common stock. EPS serves as an indicator of a company's profitability.
Long term annual growth estimate.
] offsetx=[-305] delay=[500]">EPS growth
next 5 years

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Sales Growth Past 5 Years] body=["
                
                  

                    Annual growth over past 5 years.
                  
                ] delay=[500]">Sales growth
past 5 years

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Earnings Per Share, Growth Quarter Over Quarter] body=["
EPS is the portion of a company's profit allocated to each outstanding share of common stock. EPS serves as an indicator of a company's profitability.
Quarter over quarter growth.
] delay=[500]">EPS growth
qtr over qtr

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Sales Growth Quarter Over Quarter] body=["
                
                  

                    Quarter over quarter growth.
                  
                ] delay=[500]">Sales growth
qtr over qtr

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Dividend Yield] body=["
                
                  

                    The dividend yield equals the annual dividend per share divided by the stock’s price. This measurement tells what percentage return a company pays out to shareholders in the form of dividends.
                  
                ] delay=[500]">Dividend Yield

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Return on Assets (ttm)] body=["
                
                  

                    An indicator of how profitable a company is relative to its total assets. ROA gives an idea as to how efficient management is at using its assets to generate earnings. Calculated by dividing a company's annual earnings by its total assets, ROA is displayed as a percentage.
                  
                ] delay=[500]">Return on Assets

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Return on Equity (ttm)] body=["
                
                  

                    A measure of a corporation's profitability that reveals how much profit a company generates with the money shareholders have invested. Calculated as Net Income / Shareholder's Equity.
                  
                ] delay=[500]">Return on Equity

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Return on Investment (ttm)] body=["
                
                  

                    Performance measure used to evaluate the efficiency of an investment or to compare the efficiency of a number of different investments. To calculate ROI, the benefit (return) of an investment is divided by the cost of the investment: (Gain from Investment - Cost of Investment) / Cost of Investment.
                  
                ] delay=[500]">Return on Investment

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Current Ratio (mrq)] body=["
                
                  

                    A liquidity ratio that measures a company's ability to pay short-term obligations. Calculated as Current Assets / Current Liabilities.
                  
                ] delay=[500]">Current Ratio

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Quick Ratio (mrq)] body=["
                
                  

                    An indicator of a company's short-term liquidity. The quick ratio measures a company's ability to meet its short-term obligations with its most liquid assets. The higher the quick ratio, the better the position of the company. Calculated as (Current Assets - Inventories) / Current Liabilities.
                  
                ] delay=[500]">Quick Ratio

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Long Term Debt to Equity (mrq)] body=["
                
                  

                    A measure of a company's financial leverage calculated by dividing its long term debt by stockholders' equity. It indicates what proportion of equity and debt the company is using to finance its assets.
                  
                ] delay=[500]">LT Debt/Equity

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Total Debt to Equity (mrq)] body=["
                
                  

                    A measure of a company's financial leverage calculated by dividing its liabilities by stockholders' equity. It indicates what proportion of equity and debt the company is using to finance its assets.
                  
                ] delay=[500]">Debt/Equity

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Gross Margin (ttm)] body=["
                
                  

                    A company's total sales revenue minus its cost of goods sold, divided by the total sales revenue, expressed as a percentage. The gross margin represents the percent of total sales revenue that the company retains after incurring the direct costs associated with producing the goods and services sold by a company. The higher the percentage, the more the company retains on each dollar of sales to service its other costs and obligations.
                  
                ] delay=[500]">Gross Margin

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Operating Margin (ttm)] body=["
                
                  

                    Operating margin is a measurement of what proportion of a company's revenue is left over after paying for variable costs of production such as wages, raw materials, etc. A healthy operating margin is required for a company to be able to pay for its fixed costs, such as interest on debt. Calculated as Operating Income / Net Sales.
                  
                ] delay=[500]">Operating Margin

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Net Profit Margin (ttm)] body=["
                
                  

                    A ratio of profitability calculated as net income divided by revenues, or net profits divided by sales. It measures how much out of every dollar of sales a company actually keeps in earnings.
                  
                ] delay=[500]">Net Profit Margin

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Payout Ratio] body=["
                
                  

                    The percentage of earnings paid to shareholders in dividends.
                  
                ] delay=[500]">Payout Ratio

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Insider Ownership] body=["
                
                  

                    Level to which a company is owned by its own management.
                  
                ] delay=[500]">Insider
Ownership

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Insider Transactions] body=["
                
                  

                    A company's shares being purchased or sold by its own management. Value represents 6-month percentual change in total insider ownership.
                  
                ] delay=[500]">Insider
Transactions

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Institutional Ownership] body=["
                
                  

                    Level to which a company is owned by financial institutions.
                  
                ] delay=[500]">Institutional
Ownership

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Institutional Transactions] body=["
                
                  

                    A company's shares being purchased or sold by financial institutions. Value represents 3-month change in institutional ownership.
                  
                ] offsetx=[-305] delay=[500]">Institutional
Transactions

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Short Selling] body=["
                
                  

                    The amount of short-selling transactions of given stock.
                  
                ] delay=[500]">Float Short

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Analyst Recommendation] body=["
                
                  

                    An outlook of a stock-market analyst on a stock.
                  
                ] delay=[500]">Analyst Recom.

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Optionable/Shortable] body=["
                
                  

                    Stocks with options and/or available to sell short.
                  
                ] delay=[500]">Option/Short

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Earnings Date] body=["
                
                  

                    Date when company reports earnings
                  
                ] delay=[500]">Earnings Date

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Performance] body=["
                
                  

                    Rate of return for a given stock.
                  
                ] delay=[500]">Performance

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Performance 2] body=["
                
                  

                    Rate of return for a given stock.
                  
                ] delay=[500]">Performance 2

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Volatility] body=["
                
                  

                    A statistical measure of the dispersion of returns for a given stock. Represents average daily high/low trading range.
                  
                ] delay=[500]">Volatility

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Relative Strength Index (14)] body=["
                
                  

                    The Relative Strength Index (RSI) is a technical analysis oscillator showing price strength by comparing upward and downward close-to-close movements.
                  
                ] delay=[500]">RSI (14)

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Gap] body=["
                
                  

                    The difference between yesterday's closing price and today's opening price.
                  
                ] delay=[500]">Gap

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[20-Day Simple Moving Average] body=["
                
                  

                    20-Day simple moving average of closing price is the mean of the previous 20 days' closing prices.
                  
                ] delay=[500]">20-Day Simple Moving Average

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[50-Day Simple Moving Average] body=["
                
                  

                    50-Day simple moving average of closing price is the mean of the previous 50 days' closing prices.
                  
                ] delay=[500]">50-Day Simple Moving Average

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[200-Day Simple Moving Average] body=["
                
                  

                    200-Day simple moving average of closing price is the mean of the previous 200 days' closing prices.
                  
                ] delay=[500]">200-Day Simple Moving Average

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Change from previous Close] body=["
                
                  

                    The difference between previous's close price and today's last price.
                  
                ] delay=[500]">Change

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Change from Open] body=["
                
                  

                    The difference between today's open price and today's last price.
                  
                ] delay=[500]">Change from Open

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[20-Day High/Low] body=["
                
                  

                    Maximum/minimum of previous 20 days' highs/lows.
                  
                ] delay=[500]">20-Day High/Low

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[50-Day High/Low] body=["
                
                  

                    Maximum/minimum of previous 50 days' highs/lows.
                  
                ] delay=[500]">50-Day High/Low

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[52-Week High/Low] body=["
                
                  

                    Maximum/minimum of previous 52 weeks' highs/lows.
                  
                ] delay=[500]">52-Week High/Low

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Pattern] body=["
                
                  

                    A chart pattern is a distinct formation on a stock chart that creates a trading signal, or a sign of future price movements. Chartists use these patterns to identify current trends and trend reversals and to trigger buy and sell signals.
                  
                ] delay=[500]">Pattern

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Candlestick] body=["
                
                  

                    Candlesticks are usually composed of the body (black or white), an upper and a lower shadow (wick). The wick illustrates the highest and lowest traded prices of a stock during the time interval represented. The body illustrates the opening and closing trades.
                  
                ] delay=[500]">Candlestick

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Beta] body=["
                
                  

                    A measure of a stock’s price volatility relative to the market. An asset with a beta of 0 means that its price is not at all correlated with the market. A positive beta means that the asset generally follows the market. A negative beta shows that the asset inversely follows the market, decreases in value if the market goes up.
                  
                ] delay=[500]">Beta

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Average True Range] body=["
                
                  

                    
                      A measure of stock volatility. The Average True Range is a exponential moving average (14-days) of the True Ranges. The range of a day's trading is high−low, True Range extends it to yesterday's closing price if it was outside of today's range, True Range =
max(high,closeprev) − min(low,closeprev)
                  
                ] delay=[500]">Average True Range

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Average Volume] body=["
                
                  

                    The average number of shares traded in a security per day.
                  
                ] offsetx=[-305] delay=[500]">Average Volume

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Relative Volume] body=["
                
                  

                    Ratio between current volume and 3-month average, intraday adjusted.
                  
                ] offsetx=[-305] delay=[500]">Relative Volume

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Current Volume] body=["
                
                  

                    Number of shares traded today.
                  
                ] offsetx=[-305] delay=[500]">Current Volume

<span class="screener-combo-title" style="cursor:pointer;" title="cssbody=[tooltip_bdy] cssheader=[tooltip_hdr] header=[Price] body=["
                
                  

                    The current stock price.
                  
                ] delay=[500]">Price
Overview
Valuation
Financial
Ownership
Performance
Technical
Custom
Charts
Tickers
Quotes
Basic
TA
News
Snapshot
